item.description:
Note: This is a scheduled "Education Night" of New England Light Painters (http://www.nelightpainters.org) in Natick.  We meet on the 2nd and 4th Monday of each month at 17 Fox Hill Drive in Natick.  Since the presentation is being done via Webex (Dick is in Scotland), we thought that it would be great to include a group of folks meeting in Worcester if there was interest.  This saves you all the drive out to Natick.

All we need is a volunteer with meeting space, a computer with an Internet connection and a projector to connect to the Webex.  You can use computer audio or a speakerphone for the audio component.  I'll be using one of those conference room multi-person speaker phones.

This is an interesting experiment in distributed presentation, and helps to deal with the fact that seating here is limited.  My hope is to retain some of the positive social aspects of meeting together.  If it works well, I'll plan some other presentations by remote speakers.  If there's interest in participating, we can do a technical dry run in advance of the meeting to make sure all of the equipment is working well.

 

Creating Interesting Abstracts from Ordinary Photographs

by Dick Crighton
March 28, 2011 @ 7:30 pm

Photoshop offers a number of interesting techniques to help you turn ordinary photographs into interesting abstracts.  Dick will use Photoshop and a selection of ordinary photographs from his collection to illustrate these techniques, and provide some insight into the creative process that this technology can facilitate.  As you can see from the before-and-after examples attached, ordinary photographs have a lot of potential.

Dick is a member of the Kinross Camera Club (www.kinrosscameraclub.org.uk), which is one of around 90 member clubs of the Scottish Photographic Federation.  During October 2010, Dick had a selection of his abstract photographs on display at the Barn Gallery, at The Bield at Blackruthven.  I had the good fortune to visit the gallery during this exhibit, see Dick's photographs, and discuss his artistic approach with him.

This presentation will be delivered via Webex, so Dick will be able to present from the comfort of his home in Scotland - though it will be 5 hours later for him.  We'll have a full audio and video connection, which Dick and I "test drove" recently, and there will be an opportunity to ask questions.

Here are some samples:
item.why: Deb's offered to have this meeting in her home! Please bring drinks and snacks to share! Thank you Deb!

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: Creating Interesting Abstracts from Ordinary Photographs-
